instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only green light, no charging
threads.message:
this macbook does not charge, only green light appears.I already did a test with another good battery and magsafe board same problem
.One piece of information: the macbook only turns on with the charger and battery, when I place only the charger, the fan restarts after a while and no video.Also battery customer its no original apple

some measurements with charger only
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=12.64
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> =3.46
measurements with charger and good battery
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=12.0
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> =3.46

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only green light, no charging
threads.message:
Post exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Check if works in SMC bypass mode, with charger only.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only green light, no charging
threads.message:
between pins  17 and 18 charger =132 ohms
between pin 27 and 28 charger=20.2 ohms

macbook with charger only turn on and video in bypass mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only green light, no charging
threads.message:
"pins  17 and 18 charger =132 ohms"
Check <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52 and their traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only green light, no charging
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR>= 130 ohm but it had a glue from the component on the side <TRANSISTOR>Q9425</TRANSISTOR> I removed it and the value was new <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR>=3.2ohms
<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>=2.4ohms
traces is good

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only green light, no charging
threads.message: Post again resistance between pins 17/18; should be 5 ohm approx.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only green light, no charging
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only green light, no charging
threads.message:
Is the battery recognized by macOS and correctly shows is percentage?

Test the board disconnecting BIL (J6955).
Post voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only green light, no charging
threads.message:
Is the battery recognized by macOS and correctly shows is percentage? yes
SCL/SDA=0.521/0.519
but it is detecting me ast bad battery and batery is good, and  fan is spinning me too much

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only green light, no charging
threads.message:
"macbook with charger only turn on and video in bypass mode"
Run HWMonitor and look for strange I/V and temp values.

Fan spining high points to some temperature sensor issue.
Did you test with known good trackpad flex/board?
Also test disconnecting webcam.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only green light, no charging
threads.message:
hello already well regulated fans; no problems.
My question is if the non-original apple battery can be the cause of problems in charger <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> or resistors?
como se si una bateria  no original de apple cumple con las especificaciones  tecnicas de voltage, corriente, capacidad y no tenga problemas en el equipo?
algun valor me pueda indicar de referencia ?
puedo seguir usando bateria no original de apple sin problemas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only green light, no charging
threads.message:
The board should turn on and boot without battery.
If only turn on in SMC bypass mode (without battery) there is a problem with a SMC sensor.
Check all sensors from pages 49-50.
Should be good to run corresponding EFI ASD test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only green light, no charging
threads.message: ok thanks, the macbook already turns me on without battery after solving the resistance problem, I already did the efi test and it passes. what I wanted to ask  you was if a non original-apple battery can cause problems on board, its possible? thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only green light, no charging
threads.message: Machine can work with non-original battery without problems.
